body_html:
@concretevitamin No problem

import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

predictions = np.array([1, 2, 3])
targets = np.array([3, 2, 1])
n = 4
sess = tf.InteractiveSession()
print tf.sparse_add(tf.zeros(tf.pack([n, n])), tf.transpose(tf.pack([predictions, targets]))).eval()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-6-e7c79bd8a1b6> in <module>()
----> 1 print tf.sparse_add(tf.zeros(tf.pack([n, n])), tf.transpose(tf.pack([predictions, targets]))).eval()

/home/lucas/Envs/tensorflow/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/sparse_ops.pyc in sparse_add(a, b, thresh)
    193   """
    194   if not any(isinstance(inp, ops.SparseTensor) for inp in [a, b]):
--> 195     raise TypeError("At least one input should be SparseTensor; do you mean to"
    196                     " use tf.add()?")
    197 

TypeError: At least one input should be SparseTensor; do you mean to use tf.add()?

body:
@concretevitamin No problem

``` python
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

predictions = np.array([1, 2, 3])
targets = np.array([3, 2, 1])
n = 4
sess = tf.InteractiveSession()
print tf.sparse_add(tf.zeros(tf.pack([n, n])), tf.transpose(tf.pack([predictions, targets]))).eval()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-6-e7c79bd8a1b6> in <module>()
----> 1 print tf.sparse_add(tf.zeros(tf.pack([n, n])), tf.transpose(tf.pack([predictions, targets]))).eval()

/home/lucas/Envs/tensorflow/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/sparse_ops.pyc in sparse_add(a, b, thresh)
    193   """
    194   if not any(isinstance(inp, ops.SparseTensor) for inp in [a, b]):
--> 195     raise TypeError("At least one input should be SparseTensor; do you mean to"
    196                     " use tf.add()?")
    197 

TypeError: At least one input should be SparseTensor; do you mean to use tf.add()?
```
